content:
respStmt

respStmtstatement of responsibility supplies a statement of responsibility for the intellectual content of a text, edition, recording, or series, where the specialized elements for authors, editors, etc. do not suffice or do not apply. May also be used to encode information about individuals or organizations which have played a role in the production or distribution of a bibliographic work. [3.12.2.2 Titles, Authors, and Editors 2.2.1 The Title Statement 2.2.2 The Edition Statement 2.2.5 The Series Statement ]
Modulecore â€” Elements common to all TEI documents
Attributes
  • att.global ( @xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space ) (att.global.rendition ( @rend, @style, @rendition ) ) (att.global.linking ( @corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select ) ) (att.global.analytic ( @ana ) ) (att.global.facs ( @facs ) ) (att.global.change ( @change ) ) (att.global.responsibility ( @cert, @resp ) ) (att.global.source ( @source ) )
  • att.canonical ( @key, @ref )

    Content model<content> <sequence> <alternate> <sequence> <elementRef key="resp" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <classRef key="model.nameLike.agent" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </sequence> <sequence> <classRef key="model.nameLike.agent" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="resp" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </sequence> </alternate> <elementRef key="note" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </sequence> </content>
